feed.title: SAP Community - SAP Datasphere
feed.subtitle: SAP Datasphere Q&A in SAP Community

entry.title: Can we connect to Azure Data lake storage Gen2 as a source in a Datasphere replication flow?
entry.content: Hi,  In the Datasphere connections I can see Azure Data Lake Storage can be used as a source in a replication flow. However, when I tried to add ADLS files in a replication flow I can't see them in the container. So, the connection is working but can't select the files to replicate? Can you tell me what type of files are allowed as source objects?  I have tried csv and parquet formats, but they don't show up.

entry.title: RF in Datasphere Unable to fetch delta data Server resources may be overloaded
entry.content: Hi, the replication flows that we are using from S/4 to Datasphere suddenly stopped transferring delta with the following message: Unable to fetch delta data from source, although data is available. Server resources may be overloaded. However what confuses me is which server is overloaded, when we checked Datasphere, S/4 and the cloud connector and they are all fine. I also opened a case for SAP but they made me restart the application flows which didn't result in any change. Has anybody encountered this before?

entry.title: SAP Datasphere CLI Pause and Resume Replication Flows
entry.content:
Hi,

is there a possibility to pause and resume replication flows by using the CLI?

 

BR Joscha

entry.title: Why can other users not see the ‚ÄúInstall‚Äù button for my published Data Product in SAP Datasphere?
entry.content:
I have created a Data Product in SAP Datasphere and published it successfully. I can find it in the Marketplace, and other users can also see it listed. However, they do not see the blue Install button, even though they have the same roles and permissions as I do.

My Data Product looks like this when I open it from the Marketplace (see Image 1). As you can see, the Install button is missing.
The Install button normally looks like in Image 2, depending on the settings of the Data Provider.

What could be the reason for this? Are there additional steps required to make the Data Product installable for other users in the same Datasphere tenant?

Any guidance or best practices would be appreciated.

entry.title: Extract data from tables where they have distinct technical id's in between environments DEV/QA/PROD
entry.content:
Do someone have faced this requirement? What is the best option?

Typical the tables are related with configuration in the application  who belongs (In my cases related with segment definition under Margin Analysis module). 

So they have different technical id's in the Development -> Quality/Test -> Productive .

If I use a Remote Table on datasphere and do the transport from DEV to productive I do not have any possible configuration to change the source reference.

Create a CDS view on top with some case to change the Id's?

Any help is welcome. Thanks

entry.title: How does things work in Dataflow
entry.content:
One question to the Guru's ‚Ä¶.

I have one CDS based extractor, which is not delta enabled. Each time I load data, I do a selective full load.

My selective full load usually happens on 1 field, that is Fiscal Period.

Each time, I want to dynamically bring in Current year full data. What it means is, my selections for extraction of data for 2025 would be
2025001 to 2025010

As I cannot achieve this dynamic value passing in Replication flow, I might need to use Dataflow.

Even in Dataflow, as part of objects, I would add this CDS view as first object. But I will not get an option of filter on CDS view. So, I would add a projection for this CDS view in Dataflow and then apply filter on Fiscal period.

When we execute the dataflow, how does it work? I mean, since CDS view is the first object in the dataflow, it will bring all data and then gets filtered out at Projection level. Or how does it work?

entry.title: Passing Data Access control in datasphere to Power BI
entry.content:
I am implementing a critical reporting solution connecting Power BI Service to SAP Datasphere and want to enforce Data Access Control (DAC)/Row-Level Security (RLS) defined in Datasphere.
The Goal is- To ensure that the Data Access Control (DAC) defined on Analytical Models in SAP Datasphere is respected when the data is consumed by individual users in a Power BI report.

Kindly also suggest which connection method will be the best considering the requirement.

Any guidance, particularly from those who have successfully implemented this integration, would be greatly appreciated.

entry.title: Replacement of 0FI_ACDOCA_20 with I_GLAccountLineItemRawData ‚Äì Cumulative Balance Implementation
entry.content:
I‚Äôm currently working on replacing the 0FI_ACDOCA_20 datasource with the CDS view I_GLAccountLineItemRawData in SAP Datasphere.

One key field in the original extractor is the cumulative balance, which is not directly available in the CDS view. I‚Äôm planning to recreate this logic within Datasphere.kindly let me know screen shot of datasphere how to create cumulative balance measures.

Regards,

Shan

entry.title: Datasphere hierarchy, how to enable node level posting
entry.content:
Hi , 

I'm having difficulty to create hierarchy in Datasphere.

In my scenario, I want to use all nodes of the hierarchy as leaf node, as we are also posting amounts to upper nodes. Sample below, we have entries for 11 (is also including its own entries as 500 other than values from its sub nodes 11A and 11B) and 11A and 11B. 

Root Node Total amount to be shown 1800
Level 1 : Node ID 11 is having amount 500
Level2 : Node ID 11A child of 11 is having amount 600
Level2 : Node ID 11B child of 11 is having amount 700

In datasphere if I create a hierarchy, it is showing total amount as 1300 (sum of 11A and 11B) even after defining all nodes as leaf nodes. The same hierarhcy is working fine on S/4 HANA based hierarchy, as S/4 HANA is showing the additional amounts under not assgined and as total I can see 1800.  I owuld like to know if  it is also possible to define same in Datasphere hierarchy ? 

Thanks

entry.title: STVARVC in BW Bridge?
entry.content:
Hello,

We have a flow in BW that relies on the usage of TVARVC. Does this table exist in BW Bridge, or should we build something from scratch to serve its purpose?

Regards,
Dimitar

entry.title: Data Product in Datasphere does not update after changes to the underlying view
entry.content:
Hey everyone,
I created a Data Product based on a view in Space A. Then I installed this Data Product from the Marketplace into Space B. In Space B, the Data Product appears as a view, and I built an Analytic Model on top of it, which I use in SAC.

Recently, I added a new column to the original view in Space A. However, this column does not appear in the view in Space B or in my SAC story.

My question:
Does a Data Product not automatically update when the underlying view changes? Is there a specific step I need to perform to apply these changes?

Thank you for your support!

entry.title: Is it possible to publish an SAC dashboard as a Data Product in the SAP Datasphere Marketplace?
entry.content:
Hey everyone,
Is it possible to publish an SAC dashboard as a Data Product in the SAP Datasphere Marketplace and then open it via a URL?
Additionally, if this is possible, can specific permissions (e.g., access rights to the dashboard) be requested or managed through the Data Product?

Thank you for your support!

entry.title: How to dynamically split comma-separated values into multiple rows in SAP Datasphere
entry.content:
I am working in SAP Datasphere (Data Builder ‚Äì Graphical View) and I have a column that contains comma-separated values inside a single row. Example:

ID

Observee(s)

19195

0039270, 0040932, 00051689

43400

00055233

121461

NULL

My requirement is to dynamically split these comma-separated values into individual rows, like this:

ID

Observee

19195

0039270

19195

0040932

19195

00051689

43400

00055233

I need a solution that is 

Dynamic (not limited to a fixed number of values like 5 or 10)

 Works in SAP Datasphere (Graphical View OR HANA SQL

Works even when:

  • number of comma-separated values varies per row
  • values sometimes contain spaces
  • column type is NVARCHAR
  • JSON_TABLE or STRING_TO_TABLE are not supported
  • Recursion is not enabled in Datasphere SQL View 
  • So far, I tried:
  • JSON_TABLE() ‚Üí not supported
  • STRING_TO_TABLE() ‚Üí not supported
  • Recursive CTE ‚Üí not allowed inside Data Builder SQL View
  • Regular expression functions ‚Üí no REGEXP_SUBSTR in Graphical View
  • Calculated Columns ‚Üí no built-in SPLIT or explode function

Is there any recommended Datasphere pattern for splitting CSV string fields into multiple records?

Is this possible in:

  • Graphical View (Projection, Aggregation, Calculated Column, etc.)
    or
  • SQL View using functions supported by SAP HANA Cloud?

If someone can provide either:

A working SQL example

or

A correct modeling approach in Datasphere

entry.title: Error when querying a SAC story that consumes data from an analytical model in SAP Datasphere
entry.content:
Hello everyone,

We are currently experiencing issues running SAC stories that consume SAP Datasphere analytical models. This issue has arisen during this summer. We have already created a SAP CASE, but we haven‚Äôt received any solution yet . For now, expanding the SAP Datasphere parameters is ruled out due to its extra cost.

We would appreciate any help to unblock this problem. The issue is that the execution time of SAC stories has increased significantly (there hasn‚Äôt been any notable increase in data), and in the worst cases, the report execution ends with a timeout (we are aware of the 3-minute limitation).

What concerns us is that the SAC report only displays a table with about 20,000 records. The analytical model consumes a view that is persisted. Furthermore, there are no other processes running in parallel, and the number of SAC executions is minimal.

The error message is:

"code":"inaTimeout","details":{"stack":"See correlation id ada620af-5346-439b-5037-5292cab57589","message":"execution aborted by timeout, Code: 613, SQL State: HY000","code":613,"sqlState":"HY000","name":"HanaError","originalMessage":"execution aborted by timeout"}}

The note related to SAC Timeout is:

0003584795 - Timeout Issue with Analytic Model in SAP Datasphere

Thanks in advance.

Regards,

Miquel

entry.title: How to Write to Space-Owned Tables (FSDM_DEMO) in SAP Datasphere ?
entry.content:
Hello,

We have a local table DQ_RESULTS in the FSDM_DEMO space in SAP Datasphere.
Using the Datasphere UI, we can load data into this table through Data Flows or Transformation Flows without any issue.

However, we want to implement a stored procedure that should:

  1. Read records from the view DQ_RULE_GENERATED_VW, which contains dynamically generated SQL statements (as column values).

  2. Execute each of these SQL statements dynamically.

  3. Insert the results into the DQ_RESULTS table in the FSDM_DEMO space.

Since SAP Datasphere does not support creating stored procedures directly in the UI, we attempted to build the procedure using the HANA Database Explorer.
But the database user available to us does not have the required SELECT/INSERT privileges on the FSDM_DEMO schema, so the procedure cannot read from or write to the table.

We also tried creating a Database User Group (DUG).
The DUG schema that gets created does not have read/write access to the DQ_RESULTS table in FSDM_DEMO.

We tested multiple users:

  • FSDM_DEMO# ‚Üí does not have read/write access to DQ_RESULTS

  • DWCDBUSER# ‚Üí has only SELECT, no INSERT privileges

So far, none of the technical options allow us to run a stored procedure or write into FSDM_DEMO tables.

Additional Issue

We are also connecting to the DQ_RESULTS table via a Python script using the DWCDBUSER# user.
Again, this user can read the table but cannot write to it.

All our tables, views, and flows are created inside the FSDM_DEMO space, so we need a supported way to write to these Datasphere-owned objects from:

  • Stored procedures

  • Database User Group schemas

  • External scripts (Python)

At the moment we are completely blocked due to insufficient privileges, and it‚Äôs unclear whether such write access is intentionally restricted by design or if we are missing a configuration step.

Question

Is there any supported approach in SAP Datasphere that allows:

  • dynamic SQL execution,

  • writing results into a space-owned table,

  • or enabling external tools (like Python) to write into space-managed objects?

If stored procedures, DUG schemas, and tenant-level users are intentionally restricted from inserting into space object tables, guidance on alternative supported patterns would be very helpful.

Any help or clarification would be greatly appreciated.

Thanks,
Mayura

entry.title: SAP Datasphere vs Others (GCP, Azure, etc) - Business Case ??
entry.content:
Dear all,

I hope you have a very nice day! Sorry for the long question below. I am trying to set up the context and get some other inputs than what I see at the moment.

I am currently working with a client trying to make his way in the great world of Data. Basically, the situation is that the core processes of a Business Area will run with SAP (target is 1 instance and not 3 as today, ECC for now, but S/4 in the near future), and other specific applications. The implementation of SAP involved the implementation of a BW on HANA system (Yes, I know...not the latest stuff). But instead of feeding the BW through regular datasource extractions, they leveraged an SLT system to be near real time for most of their reports sourcing data from their current various SAP landscape. So, they have "rebuilt" lots of calculation views to support their business users. They also have many front ends (BOBJ, PowerBI, Spotfire, and other specialized applications). The maturity of BI is still, not low, but more oriented on checking consistency, very operational and less strategic than it could be. 

So we have : ECCs -> SLT -> HANA DB -> CalcViews -> Composite Providers (for managing authorizations)

They are at a stage of the implementation where the question has been raised to move to SAP Datasphere or to another data manager provider (something like Azure, GCP, Snowflake). The question is raised because they do not have only SAP data, and the overall group (other business areas are in the group) direction is to go to a non SAP landscape for data analytics.

The current exercise is to analyze the options, and choose the most long term viable one: staying with SAP analytics solutions, or moving away. In my current analysis, I am struggling because I don't find any "automatic" ways to convert/migrate the calculation views from BW on HANA directly to SAP Datasphere, provided by SAP. 

I have found the HANACV2SQL software, but I would have had expected SAP to support that kind of scenario. 

So, my question is : What could be the arguments to keep SAP Datasphere when:

  • what ever happens, you will need to convert using the same tool at the same costs ?
  • connectivity to front ends will be subject to reinstallation
  • row level security needs to be reimplemented 
  • SAP Datasphere restricts "data replication" to other systems if the data is used for other applications.

I have been working in the SAP ecosystem for a long time, and the Analytics strategy has always been hard to implement with SAP. The 0 copy concepts and the sharing capabilities promoted by SAP Datasphere (even the partnerships with Snowflake and GCP) are not clear form my point of view. Even if the client is SAP Centric, you need dedicated resources on the technology, which could lead to higher costs...

Any arguments that you have seen promoting one side more than another ?

 

Thanks for reading and sharing üòâ

 

Cheers

entry.title: Scheduling a story based on a live SAP Datasphere solution connection
entry.content:
Hi, 

in the roadmap I have seen that it should now be possible to schedule SAC stories based on datasphere data.

But apparently you need to have a tunnel connection rather then a live connection.

Does someone know how to setup such a connection as I couldn't find something in the documentation for datasphere.

BR Joscha

entry.title: How to update a source of an UNION in a graphical view
entry.content:
Hi,

We‚Äôve encountered another usability issue and a bug in the graphical views when using UNION. Let‚Äôs see if anyone has a different approach that makes it work.

We have views that perform a union of different data sources. The problem arises when one of the data sources adds new fields. When opening the UNION view, it indicates that the new fields have been excluded from the projection, which is fine so far.

The issue comes when you include them back in the projection, and DSP automatically adds them as new fields to the UNION:

  • If you wanted to do a manual mapping, you have to review the fields and delete them ‚Ä¶ extra work.
  • If the technical name already exists in the UNION, then it maps the field to the existing one but also adds the field, causing an error in the view due to duplicate fields.

Here‚Äôs an example:
We have a field "Line Currency" (technical name: LINE_CURRENCY) that is already in the UNION OUTPUT and mapped by other sources, but not by the source we are updating.

Now that source is updated and the field is added. When we make it visible, that‚Äôs when it does the "magic" and breaks everything.

The added field is mapped to the existing "Line Currency", but it adds also the added field, generating the output with 2 fields with same Techical name.

Bonus Track: The validation of the UNION is OK, but the validation of the view FAILS due to duplicated values in techincal names (It seems that UNION is more "laid-back" üòÑ ).

This repeats every time we update a view in the union ‚Ä¶ creating risk and lack of confidence because it modifies something automatically, generating errors, and we have to manually review the process to delete duplicate fields, ensure they are correctly mapped, and of course review everything again. With an average of about 40 fields and 10-15 sources per union, we end up losing a lot of time on this.

Maybe someone has another way to do it?

entry.title: Datasphere: Hiding dimensions used for filtering from the Analytic Model reporting structure
entry.content:
Hello,

In BW Queries, there is the option to filter on a characteristic which is not necessarily part of the drill-down structure of the query. In Datasphere if I choose to uncheck the dimension from the source, I cannot define a filter on it, but I also don't have (or can't find) the option to somehow exclude that from the AM reporting structure if I have a filter defined on it. Kind of how Measures can be made "Auxilary", but for Dimensions.

Here is an example:

I have 0VENDOR and MAT_SALES__0VENDOR. I would like to filter on MAT_SALES__0VENDOR, but report on 0VENDOR and remove MAT_SALES__0VENDOR from the structure to avoid confusion in reporting(not see it in the Preview, nor SAC)

Can someone confirm that this is not available and if not, please enlighten me on how it's done.

Regards,

Dimitar

entry.title: BDC Core cockpit missing in SAP4ME?
entry.content: I don't see it in Portfolio and Products. The tile seems to be missing. I'm checking as a super admin.
